data.title: The Political Graveyard: Index to Politicians: Price
meta_keywords:
political biography history genealogy 
cemeteries politics candidates congress senators legislators governors 
politicians biographies ancestors mayors birthplace geography elections
data.meta_description:
A database of political history and 
cemeteries, with brief biographical entries for 320,919
U.S. political figures, living and dead, from the 1700s to the present.
data.text:
PRICE: See also Sterling Price Beaven — John William Bennett — Mrs. Walter Price Bevis — Marcus M. Boyd — James Price Briscoe — John Price Buchanan — Price Campbell — Samuel Price Carson — Reece Arnold Caudle — Roy A. Chambers — William Alexander Cocke — John Price Collins — Daniel Ward Connolly — B. O. Cresap — Marion Price Daniel — Marion Price Daniel Jr. — Clyde C. Dawson — Jane Dice — George A. Dix — Price P. Dowdy — Florence Price Dwyer — William Price Elmer — Walter C. Frank — John Ralph Gasque — Stirling Price Gilbert — Thomas Jefferson Graham — Price H. Green — John William Griggs — John Mickle Hemphill — Alexander Hemphill — Bernhart Henn — Price Hopkins — Thomas Lemuel James — Bela E. Kennedy — Absalom Price Lanning — Daniel Dixon Lee — Price Littleton — James Kenneth Logan — Denzil Price Marshall Jr. — Price A. Martin — Thomson Francis Mason — Alice Mayo — John McCoy — William McCoy — David John McDonald — Price McGinnis — Kenneth Price Moorefield — J. Price Oyler — Thomas Stuart Price Perriello — D. Price Porter — Anne B. Price-Mills — Leighton Price Ravenscroft — Ruby Price Robinson — Winthrope Price Rowe — William Russell — Katharine Price Collier St. George — Terry Doyle Schrunk — George F. Shannon — Jane Price Sharp — George Price Shaw — Joel Price Shedd — Mrs. Price Shoffner — Melvin Claude Snyder — Samuel Spencer — Leonard Price Stavisky — James Price Stevens — Sterling Price Strong — Joel Price Tribble — Everette Geoffrey Truly Jr. — Edward Butterfield Vreeland — Irving Price Wanger — William Caesar Warfield — M. Price Webb — Samuel Welsh — N. Price Whitaker — Daniel Price White — Price Williams Sr. — A. Price Woodard Jr. Price, A. C. — Candidate for Presidential Elector for Pennsylvania. Burial location unknown. Price, A. Robert — of Cape Girardeau, Cape Girardeau County, Mo. Mayor of Cape Girardeau, Mo., 1968-69. Still living as of 1969. Price, A. S. — of Calhoun County, W.Va. Member of West Virginia state house of delegates from Calhoun County, 1872. Burial location unknown. Price, Al — Democrat. Candidate for Texas state house of representatives 22nd District. Still living as of 1998. Price, Allen — of Eubank, Pulaski County, Ky. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Kentucky, 2004. Still living as of 2004. Price, Amanda — of Holland, Ottawa County, Mich. Republican. Member of Michigan state house of representatives 89th District; elected 2012. Female. Still living as of 2012. Price, Amos R. — of Gilmanton, Belknap County, N.H. Democrat. Member of New Hampshire state house of representatives from Gilmanton; elected 1938. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Andrew (1854-1909) — of Thibodaux, Lafourche Parish, La. Born in Louisiana, 1854. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Louisiana, 1888 (member, Committee on Permanent Organization); U.S. Representative from Louisiana 3rd District, 1889-97. Died in 1909 (age about 55 years). Interment at Mt. Olivet Cemetery, Nashville, Tenn.

See also congressional biography — Govtrack.us page

Price, Mrs. Andrew — of Marlinton, Pocahontas County, W.Va. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from West Virginia, 1924. Female. Burial location unknown. Price, Anna — of Harrisburg, Dauphin County, Pa. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Pennsylvania, 1984. Female. Still living as of 1984. Price, Annie Lola (1903-1972) — Born June 7, 1903. Judge, Alabama Court of Appeals, 1951-72; appointed 1951. Female. Died June 18, 1972 (age 69 years, 11 days). Interment at Cullman Cemetery, Cullman, Ala. Price, Arthur B. — of Baltimore, Md. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Maryland, 1952, 1956. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Augustus H. — of Salisbury, Rowan County, N.C. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from North Carolina, 1908. Burial location unknown. Price, B. T., Sr. — of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake County, Utah. Candidate in primary for mayor of Salt Lake City, Utah, 1985. Still living as of 1985. Price, Barzillai — of Jefferson County, Neb. Delegate to Nebraska state constitutional convention, 1871. Burial location unknown. Price, Ben — Green. Candidate for U.S. Representative from Pennsylvania 19th District, 2002. Still living as of 2002. Price, Benjamin Marsh (1809-1892) — also known as Benjamin M. Price — of Woodbridge, Middlesex County, N.J.; Rahway, Union County, N.J. Born in Rahway, Union County, N.J., October 4, 1809. Democrat. Banker; member of New Jersey state house of assembly from Union County, 1858; delegate to Democratic National Convention from New Jersey, 1864. Died in Rahway, Union County, N.J., September 10, 1892 (age 82 years, 342 days). Interment at Rahway Cemetery, Rahway, N.J.

See also Find-A-Grave memorial

Price, Bernard — of Atlanta, Fulton County, Ga. Honorary Vice-Consul for Costa Rica in Atlanta, Ga., 1935. Burial location unknown. Price, Betsy — of Fort Worth, Tarrant County, Tex. Mayor of Fort Worth, Tex.; elected 2011. Female. Still living as of 2011. Price, Beulah G. — of Astoria, Fulton County, Ill. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Illinois, 1936, 1940 (alternate). Female. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Bill See W. T. Price Price, Bill — of Oklahoma City, Oklahoma County, Okla. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from Oklahoma, 2008. Still living as of 2008. Price, Bob See Robert Dale Price Price, Bob — Republican. Candidate for U.S. Representative from Texas 13th District, 1992. Still living as of 1992. Price, Bob — of North Las Vegas, Clark County, Nev. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Nevada, 1996. Still living as of 1996. Price, Bonnie Burns — Democrat. Candidate for Presidential Elector for California. Female. Still living as of 2012. Price, Bruce K. — of Baltimore, Md. Republican. Candidate for mayor of Baltimore, Md., 1991. Still living as of 1991. Price, Bushrod W. — of Grave Creek, Va. (now Moundsville, Marshall County, W.Va.). Democrat. Postmaster at Grave Creek, Va., 1833-41. Burial location unknown. Price, Bushrod W. — of Marshall County, W.Va. Member of West Virginia state senate 2nd District, 1873-75, 1885-88. Burial location unknown. Price, C. D. See Chauncey D. Price Price, C. D. — of Stanley, Page County, Va. Democrat. Member of Virginia state house of delegates, 1950. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Caleb — of Mobile, Mobile County, Ala. Mayor of Mobile, Ala., 1868-70. Burial location unknown. Price, Calvin J. — of Lee County, Iowa. Delegate to Iowa state constitutional convention from Lee County, 1844. Burial location unknown. Price, Celsus — Member of Missouri state senate 31st District, 1873-76. Burial location unknown. Price, Charles — Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from North Carolina, 1880. Burial location unknown. Price, Charles — of Salisbury, Rowan County, N.C. Born in North Carolina. Republican. Lawyer; attorney for Richmond and Danville Railroad; U.S. Attorney for the Western District of North Carolina, 1889-93. Burial location unknown. Price, Charles C. — of Indiana. Democrat. Candidate for U.S. Representative from Indiana 3rd District, 1952. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Charles E. — Republican. Candidate for Presidential Elector for Georgia. Still living as of 1972. Price, Charles F. — of Mesa, Maricopa County, Ariz. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from Arizona, 1920. Burial location unknown. Price, Charles H. — of Michigan. Candidate for U.S. Representative from Michigan 3rd District, 1910. Burial location unknown. Price, Charles H. II (1931-2012) — of Missouri. Born in Kansas City, Jackson County, Mo., April 1, 1931. Banker; U.S. Ambassador to Belgium, 1981-83; Great Britain, 1983-89. Died January 12, 2012 (age 80 years, 286 days). Burial location unknown.

See also U.S. State Dept career summary — NNDB dossier

Price, Charles M. — of Rockville, Montgomery County, Md. Democrat. Postmaster at Rockville, Md., 1855-56. Burial location unknown. Price, Charles Melvin (1905-1988) — also known as Melvin Price — of East St. Louis, St. Clair County, Ill. Born in East St. Louis, St. Clair County, Ill., January 1, 1905. Democrat. Secretary to U.S. Rep. Edwin M. Schaefer, 1933-43; served in the U.S. Army during World War II; U.S. Representative from Illinois, 1945-88 (22nd District 1945-49, 25th District 1949-53, 24th District 1953-73, 23rd District 1973-83, 21st District 1983-88); died in office 1988. Catholic. Member, American Legion; Amvets; Knights of Columbus; Moose; Eagles; Elks; Ancient Order of Hibernians. Died in Camp Springs, Prince George's County, Md., April 22, 1988 (age 83 years, 112 days). Interment at Mt. Carmel Cemetery, Belleville, Ill.

See also congressional biography — Govtrack.us page

Price, Chauncey D. — also known as C. D. Price — of Rupert, Greenbrier County, W.Va. Republican. Chair of Greenbrier County Republican Party, 1940-54, 1961-63; candidate for Presidential Elector for West Virginia. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Christian — of Maricopa, Pinal County, Ariz. Mayor of Maricopa, Ariz., 2013. Still living as of 2014. Price, Clarence N. — of Pittsburg, Crawford County, Kan. Republican. Mayor of Pittsburg, Kan.; elected 1903. Burial location unknown. Price, Clinton G. — of Mauston, Juneau County, Wis. Republican. Delegate to Republican National Convention from Wisconsin, 1924. Burial location unknown. Price, Curren D., Jr. — of Inglewood, Los Angeles County, Calif. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from California, 2008. Still living as of 2008. Price, Cy See J. D. Price Price, D. J. — of New Orleans, Orleans Parish, La. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from Louisiana, 1888. Burial location unknown. Price, Daniel — of Essex County, N.J. Member of New Jersey state house of assembly from Essex County, 1853-54. Burial location unknown. Price, Daniel W. — of Iowa. Delegate to Iowa state constitutional convention 12th District, 1857. Burial location unknown. Price, Darin (b. 1963) — of McKinleyville, Humboldt County, Calif. Born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, Calif., 1963. Natural Law candidate for Governor of California, 2003. Still living as of 2003. Price, David — of Newark, Essex County, N.J. Republican. Postmaster at Newark, N.J., 1861-66. Burial location unknown. Price, David Eugene (b. 1940) — also known as David E. Price — of Chapel Hill, Orange County, N.C. Born in Erwin, Unicoi County, Tenn., August 17, 1940. Democrat. Legislative aide, U.S. Senator E. L. 'Bob' Bartlett, 1963-67; university professor; North Carolina Democratic state chair, 1983-84; U.S. Representative from North Carolina 4th District, 1987-95, 1997-; defeated, 1994; delegate to Democratic National Convention from North Carolina, 2000, 2004, 2008. Baptist. Still living as of 2014.

See also congressional biography — Govtrack.us page — NNDB dossier

Price, Donald E. — of Monongalia County, W.Va. Republican. Candidate for West Virginia state house of delegates from Monongalia County, 1968. Still living as of 1968. Price, Dwight S. — of Delhi Township, Ingham County, Mich. Supervisor of Delhi Township, Michigan, 1868-69, 1871-72. Burial location unknown. Price, E. F. — of Danville, Montour County, Pa. Burgess of Danville, Pennsylvania, 1923. Burial location unknown. Price, Ed W. — of Turlock, Stanislaus County, Calif. Postmaster at Turlock, Calif., 1887. Burial location unknown. Price, Edward — of Chicago, Cook County, Ill. Republican. Delegate to Republican National Convention from Illinois, 1956. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Edward — Candidate for Presidential Elector for Ohio. Still living as of 1972. Price, Edward A. — of Media, Delaware County, Pa. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from Pennsylvania, 1900. Burial location unknown. Price, Edward Dean (1919-1997) — Born in Sanger, Fresno County, Calif., February 12, 1919. U.S. District Judge for the Eastern District of California, 1979-89; took senior status 1989. Died November 3, 1997 (age 78 years, 264 days). Burial location unknown.

See also federal judicial profile — Biographical Directory of Federal Judges

Price, Edward L. — of Essex County, N.J. Member of New Jersey state house of assembly from Essex County, 1866, 1868. Burial location unknown. Price, Edwin — of Grand Junction, Mesa County, Colo. Postmaster at Grand Junction, Colo., 1901. Burial location unknown. Price, Edwinah — of St. Anne, Kankakee County, Ill. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Illinois, 1972. Female. Still living as of 1972. Price, Eli K. (b. 1797) — of Philadelphia, Philadelphia County, Pa. Born July 20, 1797. Whig. Lawyer; member of Pennsylvania state senate 1st District, 1854-56. Burial location unknown.

Relatives: Brother of William Price.

Price, Elijah — of Cayuga County, N.Y. Member of New York state assembly from Cayuga County, 1807-08. Burial location unknown. Price, Eliphalet I. — of Colorado Springs, El Paso County, Colo. Republican. Postmaster at Colorado Springs, Colo., 1879-87. Burial location unknown. Price, Emory Hilliard (1899-1976) — also known as Emory H. Price — of Jacksonville, Duval County, Fla. Born in Bostwick, Putnam County, Fla., December 3, 1899. Democrat. U.S. Representative from Florida 2nd District, 1943-49; alternate delegate to Democratic National Convention from Florida, 1952. Died in Jacksonville, Duval County, Fla., February 11, 1976 (age 76 years, 70 days). Interment at Greenlawn Cemetery, Jacksonville, Fla.

See also congressional biography — Govtrack.us page

Price, Ernest B. — U.S. Vice Consul in Tientsin, as of 1917; Peking, as of 1919; Canton, as of 1921; U.S. Consul in Foochow, as of 1924-27; Nanking, as of 1929. Burial location unknown. Price, Everett M. — of Bellport, Suffolk County, Long Island, N.Y. Democrat. Chair of Suffolk County Democratic Party, 1927. Burial location unknown. Price, Everett N. — of Long Island (unknown county), N.Y. Prohibition candidate for New York state senate 1st District, 1908. Burial location unknown. Price, F. M. — of Marinette County, Wis. Republican. Elected Wisconsin state assembly from Marinette County 2nd District 1902. Burial location unknown. Price, Florence Louise See Florence Price Dwyer Price, Foster — of Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, Calif. Democrat. Alternate delegate to Democratic National Convention from California, 1968. Still living as of 1968. Price, Four — Republican. Member of Texas state house of representatives 87th District; elected 2010, 2012. Still living as of 2012. Price, Frank — of Henry County, Iowa. Delegate to Iowa convention to ratify 21st amendment from Henry County, 1933. Burial location unknown. Price, Frank A. — of Albany County, N.Y. Socialist. Candidate for New York state assembly from Albany County 1st District, 1916; candidate for Justice of New York Supreme Court 3rd District, 1928. Burial location unknown. Price, Frank J. — of Brooklyn, Kings County, N.Y. Republican. Member of New York state assembly from Kings County 12th District, 1900-01. Burial location unknown. Price, Frank J. — of Lackawaxen, Pike County, Pa. Democrat. Alternate delegate to Democratic National Convention from Pennsylvania, 1928. Burial location unknown. Price, Franklin — of Bloomington, McLean County, Ill. Mayor of Bloomington, Ill., 1855-56. Burial location unknown. Price, Fred R. — of Sault Ste. Marie, Chippewa County, Mich. Mayor of Sault Ste. Marie, Mich., 1903. Burial location unknown. Price, Fred W. — of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake County, Utah. Republican. Delegate to Republican National Convention from Utah, 1916. Burial location unknown. Price, Frederick M. — of Indiana. Socialist. Candidate for U.S. Representative from Indiana 6th District, 1904. Burial location unknown. Price, G. J. — of Flora, Clay County, Ill. Postmaster at Flora, Ill., 1901. Burial location unknown. Price, George See S. George Price Price, Mrs. George — of Aiken, Aiken County, S.C. Republican. Delegate to Republican National Convention from South Carolina, 1972. Female. Still living as of 1972. Price, George A. — of Sumter County, Ala. Delegate to Alabama convention to ratify 21st amendment from Sumter County, 1933. Burial location unknown. Price, George Edmund (b. 1848) — also known as George E. Price — of Frederick, Frederick County, Md.; Keyser, Mineral County, W.Va.; Charleston, Kanawha County, W.Va. Born in Moorefield, Hardy County, Va. (now W.Va.), November 9, 1848. Democrat. Lawyer; member of West Virginia state senate 12th District, 1883-90; President of the West Virginia State Senate, 1885-87; vice-president, Kanawha Banking & Trust Co.; director, Bouvier-Jaeger Coal Land Co. Presbyterian. Member, American Bar Association. Burial location unknown.

Relatives: Son of George Richard Coale Price and Catharine (Cunningham) Price; married, June 12, 1878, to Sallie A. Dorsey.

Price, George W., Jr. — of North Carolina. Republican. Delegate to Republican National Convention from North Carolina, 1880. African ancestry. Burial location unknown. Price, Guy — of Sussex County, N.J. Member of New Jersey state house of assembly from Sussex County, 1850-51. Burial location unknown. Price, H. L. — of Palestine, Anderson County, Tex. Republican. Delegate to Republican National Convention from Texas, 1904, 1912. Burial location unknown. Price, H. L. See Henry Lawson Price Price, Hampton See J. Hampton Price Price, Hank See Henry Herbert Price Price, Harry C. — of Beatrice, Gage County, Neb. Mayor of Beatrice, Neb., 1950. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Harry W., Jr. — of Mifflin County, Pa. Republican. Member of Pennsylvania state house of representatives from Mifflin County; elected 1952. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Hawkins F. (1822-1874) — of Georgia. Born in Raleigh, Wake County, N.C., 1822. Member of Georgia state house of representatives, 1857-58, 1863-65; delegate to Georgia secession convention, 1861. Died December 8, 1874 (age about 52 years). Interment at Cassville Cemetery, Cassville, Ga. Price, Mrs. Henry — of Addington, Jefferson County, Okla. Democrat. Alternate delegate to Democratic National Convention from Oklahoma, 1948. Female. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Henry H. — of Danville, Boyle County, Ky. Democrat. Acting postmaster at Danville, Ky., 1934-36. Burial location unknown. Price, Henry Herbert (1915-2002) — also known as Hank Price — of West Valley City, Salt Lake County, Utah. Born in Layton, Davis County, Utah, December 10, 1915. Served in the U.S. Army during World War II; justice of the peace; mayor of West Valley City, Utah, 1980-81. Died March 1, 2002 (age 86 years, 81 days). Interment at Valley View Memorial Park, West Valley City, Utah.

Relatives: Son of Herbert Boyle Price and Irma Leon (Tall) Price; married, August 5, 1937, to Mary Parr. See also Find-A-Grave memorial

Price, Henry Lawson (b. 1871) — also known as H. L. Price — of Monroe, Union County, N.C. Born in Union County, N.C., 1871. Democrat. Member of North Carolina state house of representatives from Union County, 1913-14. Methodist. Member, Modern Woodmen. Burial location unknown. Price, Henry T., Sr. — of Smyrna, Kent County, Del. Democrat. Member of Delaware state senate from Kent County 1st District, 1959-64. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Herbert V. — of York, York County, Neb. Delegate to Nebraska state constitutional convention, 1919-20. Burial location unknown. Price, Herbert W. — of New Castle County, Del. Member of Delaware state house of representatives from New Castle County 11th District, 1931-34. Burial location unknown. Price, Hickman, Jr. — of Ann Arbor, Washtenaw County, Mich. Democrat. Vice-president, Kaiser-Frazer (automobile makers); delegate to Democratic National Convention from Michigan, 1948. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown.

Relatives: Married to Margaret Price.

Price, Hiram (1814-1901) — of Davenport, Scott County, Iowa. Born in Pennsylvania, January 10, 1814. Republican. Banker; U.S. Representative from Iowa 2nd District, 1863-69, 1877-81; U.S. Commissioner of Indian Affairs, 1881-85. Died May 30, 1901 (age 87 years, 140 days). Interment at Oakdale Memorial Gardens, Davenport, Iowa.

Relatives: Father of Anna Price (who married John Forrest Dillon). See also congressional biography — Govtrack.us page

Price, Homer C. — of Newark, Licking County, Ohio. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from Ohio, 1928, 1932. Burial location unknown. Price, Howell B. — of West Memphis, Crittenden County, Ark. Mayor of West Memphis, Ark., 1954-60. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Hubert, Jr. — of Pontiac, Oakland County, Mich. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Michigan, 1976, 1996; member of Michigan state house of representatives 43rd District; elected 1998. Still living as of 1998. Price, Hugh Hiram (1859-1904) — also known as Hugh H. Price — of Black River Falls, Jackson County, Wis.; Silver City, Grant County, N.M.; Phoenix, Maricopa County, Ariz.; Denver, Colo. Born in Black River Falls, Jackson County, Wis., December 2, 1859. Republican. Lumber business; U.S. Representative from Wisconsin 8th District, 1887; member of Wisconsin state senate, 1889-91; U.S. Surveyor-General for Arizona, 1903. Member, Phi Kappa Psi. Died in Denver, Colo., December 25, 1904 (age 45 years, 23 days). Interment at Fairmount Cemetery, Denver, Colo.

Relatives: Son of William Thompson Price; married to Eliza Blakeley Graham. See also congressional biography — Govtrack.us page — Find-A-Grave memorial

Price, I. N. — Democrat. Candidate for Presidential Elector for Ohio. Burial location unknown. Price, Irving L., Jr. — of Greenport, Suffolk County, Long Island, N.Y. Republican. Member of New York state assembly from Suffolk County 1st District, 1957-61. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Isaac D. — of Newport, Jackson County, Ark. Postmaster at Newport, Ark., 1881-82, 1888-90. Burial location unknown. Price, Isachar — of Downingtown, Chester County, Pa. Democrat. Postmaster at Downingtown, Pa., 1836-41. Burial location unknown. Price, Isma Lee — of Swainsboro, Emanuel County, Ga. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Georgia, 1924, 1944. Interment somewhere in Swainsboro, Ga. Price, J. A. — of Weston, Platte County, Mo. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from Missouri, 1884. Burial location unknown. Price, J. D. — Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Georgia, 1904. Burial location unknown. Price, J. D. — also known as Cy Price — Republican. Secretary of state of Idaho, 1947-51. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, J. H. See James Houston Price Price, J. Hampton — of Leaksville (now part of Eden), Rockingham County, N.C. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from North Carolina, 1948. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Mrs. J. R. — also known as "Kitten" — of Fayette County, W.Va. Republican. Candidate for West Virginia state house of delegates from Fayette County, 1956, 1958. Female. Still living as of 1958. Price, J. W. — of Pocahontas County, W.Va. Member of West Virginia state house of delegates from Pocahontas County, 1905-06. Burial location unknown. Price, Jacob Cole — of Sussex County, N.J. Member of New Jersey state senate from Sussex County, 1904-12. Burial location unknown. Price, James — of Taylor, Lackawanna County, Pa. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from Pennsylvania, 1932. Burial location unknown. Price, James D. — Georgia commissioner of agriculture, 1913-17. Burial location unknown. Price, James H. (b. 1891) — of near Brazil, Clay County, Ind. Born in Van Buren Township, Clay County, Ind., September 1, 1891. Republican. Dairy farmer; Clay County Auditor, 1939; chair of Clay County Republican Party, 1944. Brethren. Member, Freemasons. Burial location unknown. Price, James Houston (1861-1947) — also known as J. H. Price — Born August 26, 1861. Justice of Mississippi state supreme court, 1903; appointed 1903; resigned 1903. Died March 24, 1947 (age 85 years, 210 days). Interment at Magnolia Cemetery, Magnolia, Miss.

See also Find-A-Grave memorial

Price, James Hubert (1878-1943) — also known as James H. Price — of Virginia. Born in Greenbrier County, W.Va., September 7, 1878. Democrat. Member of Virginia state house of delegates, 1916-30; candidate for Presidential Elector for Virginia; Lieutenant Governor of Virginia, 1930-38; Governor of Virginia, 1938-42; delegate to Democratic National Convention from Virginia, 1940. Member, Freemasons; Shriners. Died in Richmond, Va., November 22, 1943 (age 65 years, 76 days). Interment at Thornrose Cemetery, Staunton, Va.

The World War II Liberty ship SS James H. Price (built 1944 at Savannah, Georgia; scrapped 1964) was named for him. See also National Governors Association biography — NNDB dossier — Find-A-Grave memorial

Price, James K. — Socialist. Candidate for Presidential Elector for Louisiana. Still living as of 2020. Price, James L. (1840-1912) — of Lima, Allen County, Ohio. Born in New Hagerstown, Carroll County, Ohio, March 27, 1840. Republican. Lawyer; circuit judge in Ohio 3rd Circuit, 1895-1901; justice of Ohio state supreme court, 1901-09; chief justice of Ohio state supreme court, 1908-09. Died in 1912 (age about 72 years). Burial location unknown.

Relatives: Son of Benjamin Price and Nancy Price; married, March 10, 1868, to Elizabeth Marshall.

Price, James M. — of Leaksville (now part of Eden), Rockingham County, N.C. Democrat. Postmaster at Leaksville, N.C., 1893-97. Burial location unknown. Price, James S. — of Baxter Springs, Cherokee County, Kan. Republican. Postmaster at Baxter Springs, Kan., 1907-08. Burial location unknown. Price, Jane See Jane Dice Price, Jayne E. — of Chicago, Cook County, Ill. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from Illinois, 1968, 1972. Female. Still living as of 1972. Price, Jean — of Cascade County, Mont. Democrat. Member of Montana state house of representatives 21st District; elected 2010. Female. Still living as of 2010. Price, Jennings — of Lancaster, Garrard County, Ky. Whig. Delegate to Whig National Convention from Kentucky, 1839. Burial location unknown. Price, Jerry G. — of West Plains, Howell County, Mo. Democrat. Chair of Howell County Democratic Party, 1943. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, Jesse — of Manhattan, New York County, N.Y. Republican. Candidate for New York state assembly from New York County 23rd District, 1932. Burial location unknown. Price, Jesse — of Williamston, Martin County, N.C. Republican. Alternate delegate to Republican National Convention from North Carolina, 1932. Burial location unknown. Price, Jesse Dashiell (1863-1939) — also known as Jesse D. Price — of Salisbury, Wicomico County, Md. Born in White Haven, Wicomico County, Md., August 15, 1863. Democrat. Member of Maryland state senate from Wicomico County, 1908-14; U.S. Representative from Maryland 1st District, 1914-19. Methodist. Died in Baltimore, Md., May 14, 1939 (age 75 years, 272 days). Interment at Parsons Cemetery, Salisbury, Md.

See also congressional biography — Govtrack.us page — Find-A-Grave memorial

Price, Joel — of Thousand Oaks, Ventura County, Calif. Mayor of Thousand Oaks, Calif., 2015-16. Still living as of 2016.

Image source: City of Thousand Oaks

Price, Johanna — of Baltimore, Md. Democrat. Alternate delegate to Democratic National Convention from Maryland, 1956. Female. Still living as of 1956. Price, John — of Ontario County, N.Y. Member of New York state assembly from Ontario County, 1814-15, 1819-20. Burial location unknown. Price, John — of Somers Point, Atlantic County, N.J. Born in New Jersey. Republican. U.S. Collector of Customs, 1891. Burial location unknown. Price, John (born c.1934) — of Utah. Born about 1934. Republican. U.S. Ambassador to Mauritius, 2002-05; Seychelles, 2002-05; Comoros, 2002-05. Still living as of 2009.

See also U.S. State Dept career summary — NNDB dossier

Price, John G. — of Franklin County, Ohio. Republican. Ohio state attorney general, 1919-23. Interment at St. Joseph's Cemetery, Columbus, Ohio. Price, John H. — Republican. Candidate for Ohio state attorney general, 1928. Burial location unknown. Price, John J. — of Frostburg, Allegany County, Md. Mayor of Frostburg, Md., 1909-13. Burial location unknown. Price, John M. — of Atchison, Atchison County, Kan. Republican. Postmaster at Atchison, Kan., 1879-82. Burial location unknown. Price, John O. — of St. Louis, Mo. Republican. Delegate to Republican National Convention from Missouri, 1956. Presumed deceased. Burial location unknown. Price, John R. — Prohibition candidate for Governor of Delaware, 1904. Burial location unknown. Price, John R. — of New York, New York County, N.Y. Prohibition candidate for New York state assembly from New York County 13th District, 1919. Burial location unknown. Price, John Robert — of Wayne County, Mich. Republican. Candidate for Michigan state house of representatives from Wayne County 17th District, 1962. Still living as of 1962. Price, John W. — of Bristol, Va. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Virginia, 1912 (member, Committee on Rules and Order of Business; speaker). Burial location unknown. Price, Johnson — of California. Secretary of state of California, 1860-62. Burial location unknown. Price, Jonathan P. — of Highland Park, Wayne County, Mich. Village president of Highland Park, Michigan, 1889. Burial location unknown. Price, Judith R. — of Wintersville, Jefferson County, Ohio. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Ohio, 1972. Female. Still living as of 1972. Price, Julia — of Lawrenceville, Lawrence County, Ill. Democrat. Delegate to Democratic National Convention from Illinois, 1972. Female. Still living as of 1972. Price, Kamuela — of Hawaii. Republican. Candidate for U.S. Representative from Hawaii 2nd District, 1992. Still living as of 1992. Price, Karen — of Cotton County, Okla. Republican. Chair of Cotton County Republican Party, 2014. Female.
